dialogue.text: Anna and her bestie Cooper! Anna got Cooper as a birthday present a couple of months ago. Since then, they have been inseparable friends.
Anna wakes up to a quiet morning and notices that her usually lively dog, Cooper, isn’t his energetic self.

dialogue.speaker: Anna
dialogue.text: Cooper, how do you feel?

dialogue.speaker: Cooper
dialogue.text: Ohhh, if I could tell you how bad I feel...
Anna tries to cheer him up with his favorite squeaky toy.

dialogue.speaker: Anna
dialogue.text: Look, it’s your piggy! Let’s play!

dialogue.speaker: Cooper
dialogue.text: I’m too tired... You can play with it yourself!

dialogue.speaker: Anna
dialogue.question: Anna becomes anxious. What should Anna do?

choices.text: Ask for advice in the Dog Friends Facebook Forum.
Find a vet and book an appointment.

dialogue.text: Cooper starts crunching some suspicious object.

dialogue.speaker: Anna
dialogue.text: Cooper, spit that out!

dialogue.speaker: Anna
dialogue.text: It's tasty!
Later, Cooper feels discomfort and has trouble with stomach.
dialogue.question: What should Anna do?

choices.text: Immediately take him to the vet.

dialogue.text: Last night it was the full moon. The neighbours' dog has been barking all night. It has been a tough night, you know.
In the early morning delivery man knocks the door. Cooper became angry because he was abruptly awakened from a deep sleep.

dialogue.speaker: Cooper
dialogue.text: Who is that mean person who won't let you sleep at such an early hour?
Anna opens the door and says "Good morning" to delivery man.

dialogue.speaker: Cooper
dialogue.text: Good morning? Reallllllly?
Next second Cooper is out of the door and bits delivery man into leg. Pants are damaged. Leg is in blood.

dialogue.speaker: Anna
dialogue.text: Cooper, where are your manners?

dialogue.speaker: Cooper
dialogue.text: Pfff... I am going to sleep!!!

choices.text: Close the door, switch off the lights - nobody's at home.
Apologize profusely and promise to talk with your dog.
Apologize and offer medical help and pay for the pants.

dialogue.text: As usual, Anna and Cooper are enjoying a day in the park on Sundays. Cooper is full of energy playing with the ball.

dialogue.speaker: Anna
dialogue.text: Good boy, Cooper! Bring the ball back!
Cooper runs at incredible speed. Sharp turns, and he bumps into a park bench.

dialogue.speaker: Anna
dialogue.text: Oh no, Cooper! Are you okay?
Cooper is limping. Anna is now crying.

dialogue.speaker: Cooper
dialogue.text: Anna, don't worry, I promise I'll be more careful! One day...
Anna picks up Cooper and heads towards home.
dialogue.question: What should Anna do now?

choices.text: Buy another ball to make Cooper happier.
Take a picture for social media and wait for advice.
Observe the dog for a while and take him to the vet if needed.

dialogue.text: Congratulations! You’ve experienced Anna and Cooper’s happy and sad moments together! Cooper is doing well because Anna took care of her pet’s insurance.
